tier.item: f. Ya hemos tenido 5 años de vivir en Boston. Solicitemos la
11 In old Spanish the temporal stative verb was haber `there be'. Nowadays we still have such
expressions as Años ha que no lo veo `It is years that I have not seen him', as an impersonal
construction.
already we have had 5 years of live in Boston. Let's apply for
ciudadanía. (id)
citizenship
`We have already lived in Boston for 5 years. Let's apply for
citizenship'.

tier.item: - Tengo... de 1974, que ingresé, a la fecha que es 87: son trece años de
servicio.
I have...from 1974, that I entered, to the date which is 87: it is thirteen
years of service
`It is... since 1974, when I enrolled in August, till now, 87: it is thirteen
years of duty.'
